match.title: 2nd ODI

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 13.00 start, First Session 13.00-16.30, Interval 16.30-17.15, Second Session 17.15-20.45

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Cremer b Williams 76 (89b 6x4 4x6 127m) SR: 85.39

dismissalComment.html: he smokes a full toss straight down the fielder's throat. Comes down the track and smashes a full toss right to Cremer at long-off. He is distraught as he walks off

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Ervine b Panyangara 41 (53b 3x4 0x6 78m) SR: 77.35

dismissalComment.html: cracked to the fielder at deep midwicket. What a sound that made but he has picked out the fielder to inch-perfection. Ervine did not have to move to take that. Takes it just inside the boundary too. Short on off, Nasir stays in his crease and creams this pull but he has to go

just a thin feather and Tamim has to go. Excellent lines and lengths these. Fuller than a good length just outside off and Tamim naughtily flirts at that with a defensive prod. He gets a thin outside edge which is easily accepted by the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Liton has to go, he tries to pull a delivery from well outside off to the leg side and was in no control of his shot. The ball keeps rising and gets a thin edge which is taken by the keeper over his head. Not a good shot that.

cracked to the fielder at deep midwicket. What a sound that made but he has picked out the fielder to inch-perfection. Ervine did not have to move to take that. Takes it just inside the boundary too. Short on off, Nasir stays in his crease and creams this pull but he has to go

Mash chooses the last delivery to go for the expansive shot. Not bad cricket but execution was lacking. Back of  a length outside off, Mashrafe flat-bats the pull but doesn't get all of it. The ball lobs to long-off for a simple catch.

splendid fielding. What a catch that is. Full and wide, Sunny mis-times a drive towards cover but fails to keep it down, Ervine runs to his right, dives full-length and holds on to leave Bangladesh in further trouble

image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Chakabva b Panyangara 19 (25b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 76

dismissalComment.html: just a thin feather and Tamim has to go. Excellent lines and lengths these. Fuller than a good length just outside off and Tamim naughtily flirts at that with a defensive prod. He gets a thin outside edge which is easily accepted by the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c †Chakabva b Panyangara 7 (16b 0x4 1x6 16m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: Liton has to go, he tries to pull a delivery from well outside off to the leg side and was in no control of his shot. The ball keeps rising and gets a thin edge which is taken by the keeper over his head. Not a good shot that.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Chakabva b Cremer 4 (20b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah has to go now. The third batsman to edge to the keeper. He tries to run one off the face to third man but another edge, and the keeper takes another. Bangladesh are in a bit of trouble now

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Jongwe b Cremer 21 (28b 3x4 0x6 32m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: he is gone, huge wicket for Zim. Tossed up outside off, Rahim comes down and looks to go over cover but doesn't get to the pitch, the ball spins a tad and takes the outside edge towards short third man. The lob is well taken by the fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Cremer b Williams 76 (89b 6x4 4x6 127m) SR: 85.39

dismissalComment.html: he smokes a full toss straight down the fielder's throat. Comes down the track and smashes a full toss right to Cremer at long-off. He is distraught as he walks off

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c †Chakabva b Jongwe 33 (40b 4x4 0x6 62m) SR: 82.5

dismissalComment.html: and Sabbir goes! Opportune wicket for Zim, too full outside off, Rahman goes for a full-blooded drive but the ball kisses the outside edge and the keeper takes another catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Chibhabha b Muzarabani 13 (14b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: Mash chooses the last delivery to go for the expansive shot. Not bad cricket but execution was lacking. Back of  a length outside off, Mashrafe flat-bats the pull but doesn't get all of it. The ball lobs to long-off for a simple catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Ervine b Panyangara 41 (53b 3x4 0x6 78m) SR: 77.35

dismissalComment.html: cracked to the fielder at deep midwicket. What a sound that made but he has picked out the fielder to inch-perfection. Ervine did not have to move to take that. Takes it just inside the boundary too. Short on off, Nasir stays in his crease and creams this pull but he has to go

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny c Ervine b Muzarabani 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: splendid fielding. What a catch that is. Full and wide, Sunny mis-times a drive towards cover but fails to keep it down, Ervine runs to his right, dives full-length and holds on to leave Bangladesh in further trouble

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain 47 (77b 2x4 2x6 112m) SR: 61.03

dismissalComment.html: out, massive wicket for Bangladesh. Poor delivery, slower legcutter outside off, Chigumbura goes for the ramp over third man but doesn't get all of it, he uppishly cuts it and third man runs in and holds onto a sharp chance.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain 33 (42b 2x4 1x6 59m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: and the drinks break does the trick. Loss in concentration does it for Raza. Short outside off, Raza looks to flat-bat a pull over midwicket but the ball gets too big on him and he ends up slicing it to mid-on. Simple catch and a timely wicket for Bangladesh.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he goes! What a soft dismissal that is. Full on off, it may have been an offcutter and Williams goes after that and inside-halves it to the man at short midwicket. Poor shot and the loose cricket continues.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: bowled im. Finally, Mustafizur hits the stumps.  A quick offcutter and the off stump is uprooted. A bit too full but Jongwe misses and the stumps are rattled. Is that the final nail in the coffin? The crowd goes wild

and another, Zimbabwe are capitulating now. Short outside off, TP looks to pull into the leg side but the ball hurries onto him and deviates a touch too. Spoons up for Mash at point and Zim are nine down

and the drinks break does the trick. Loss in concentration does it for Raza. Short outside off, Raza looks to flat-bat a pull over midwicket but the ball gets too big on him and he ends up slicing it to mid-on. Simple catch and a timely wicket for Bangladesh.

out, massive wicket for Bangladesh. Poor delivery, slower legcutter outside off, Chigumbura goes for the ramp over third man but doesn't get all of it, he uppishly cuts it and third man runs in and holds onto a sharp chance.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva lbw b Arafat Sunny 1 (19b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 5.26

dismissalComment.html: that is plumb. Straighter and skids on with the arm and strikes Chakabva right in front. No spin but Chakabva is playing for some. And a horror innings for Chakabva ends

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha b Mashrafe Mortaza 14 (9b 1x4 1x6 25m) SR: 155.55

dismissalComment.html: bowled im now. Nips back in just a tad, Chibhabha brings the bat down at an angle and that results in a slightly skewed bat-face, a thick inside edge clatters into the stumps and Zim are now two down.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Nasir Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman 14 (17b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 82.35

dismissalComment.html: and he goes! What a soft dismissal that is. Full on off, it may have been an offcutter and Williams goes after that and inside-halves it to the man at short midwicket. Poor shot and the loose cricket continues.

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine run out (Litton Das) 26 (44b 3x4 0x6 68m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: that is close, poor run from Ervine. Excellent fielding from Liton at mid-off. And Ervine has to go. Pushed wider outside off and Ervine is already down the track but doesn't get close to the pitch, since he is already a few feet down, he judges the run to be there and goes through with it. Liton is quick on it and fires in an accurate throw at the non-strikers end. Ervine has to go

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and the drinks break does the trick. Loss in concentration does it for Raza. Short outside off, Raza looks to flat-bat a pull over midwicket but the ball gets too big on him and he ends up slicing it to mid-on. Simple catch and a timely wicket for Bangladesh.

dismissalComment.html: out, massive wicket for Bangladesh. Poor delivery, slower legcutter outside off, Chigumbura goes for the ramp over third man but doesn't get all of it, he uppishly cuts it and third man runs in and holds onto a sharp chance.

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 8 (22b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 36.36

dismissalComment.html: outside edge and taken by Rahim. Too short outside off and Waller rocks back and tries to power the ball through the covers but gets a thin outside edge which is well taken by Rahim standing up. Just chippin' away at these wickets are Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Mustafizur Rahman 11 (20b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: bowled im. Finally, Mustafizur hits the stumps.  A quick offcutter and the off stump is uprooted. A bit too full but Jongwe misses and the stumps are rattled. Is that the final nail in the coffin? The crowd goes wild

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: and another, Zimbabwe are capitulating now. Short outside off, TP looks to pull into the leg side but the ball hurries onto him and deviates a touch too. Spoons up for Mash at point and Zim are nine down

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: and that will be it. Easy win for Bangladesh and they complete the series win and a 2-0 lead in the series. Cremer runs past one as he tries to find some runs and Rahim does the rest.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: and that will be it. Easy win for Bangladesh and they complete the series win and a 2-0 lead in the series. Cremer runs past one as he tries to find some runs and Rahim does the rest.

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.35pm So, Bangladesh do it again, they complete yet another series win at home after taking an unassailable 2-0 lead in this three-match series. Bangladesh's bowlers were terrific yet again throughout that innings although they were made to sweat when Raza and Chigumbura were steadily getting Zimbabwe to close. However, once that stand was broken it was all downhill for Zimbabwe. Most of their batsmen struggled to get in and if they did, couldn't find run-scoring too easy. Bangladesh have completed yet another win, this time without Shakib Al Hasan. Most of the bowlers contributed and continually chipped away at the wickets, eventually bundling out Zimbabwe for 183 in the 44th over. Imrul Kayes is the Man of the Match for his match-defining 76
That is from us for the second ODI. We will be back to bring you coverage of the third and final ODI. Until then, bye.

commentPreTextItems.html: Salman: "I am interested to see how AB can play Mustafiz's off-cutter!!! He will be real challenge for any player in future."

commentTextItems.html: run-out chance missed. Pushed closer to slip and they go for the single. Mushy shouts bowler, bowler. But the throw is to the keeper

commentPreTextItems.html: Bangladesh on the verge of yet another series win at home

commentTextItems.html: huge appeal  but a very optimistic shout. Full down leg strikes Muzarabani well down leg

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: and another, Zimbabwe are capitulating now. Short outside off, TP looks to pull into the leg side but the ball hurries onto him and deviates a touch too. Spoons up for Mash at point and Zim are nine down
another delivery which just beats that outside edge. The offcutter causing problems yet again
down leg and four. Poor delivery. Full down leg, TP walks across and just gets some bat on that to the fine leg boundary.

commentPreTextItems.html: Warburton: "ODI cricket is so much more interesting after the batting powerplay was scrapped and 5 fielders allowed outside. Chasing 300 was like chasing 200 in the old days! Even with 241, this game COULD have gone either way. But its most definitely now with the Lads in Green."

commentTextItems.html: that quick offcutter outside off, snakes past the outside edge. No clue of that had TP

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Mustafizur Rahman 11 (20b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 55

commentTextItems.html: bowled im. Finally, Mustafizur hits the stumps.  A quick offcutter and the off stump is uprooted. A bit too full but Jongwe misses and the stumps are rattled. Is that the final nail in the coffin? The crowd goes wild

commentTextItems.html: overpitched on leg, smeared to deep midwicket
pushed back to the bowler defensively

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 8 (22b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 36.36

commentTextItems.html: outside edge and taken by Rahim. Too short outside off and Waller rocks back and tries to power the ball through the covers but gets a thin outside edge which is well taken by Rahim standing up. Just chippin' away at these wickets are Bangladesh
quick down leg, Waller misses. May have kissed the pad on the way to Rahim

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: uppishly cuts past point, a bit too short outside off on that occasion
skids on to Jongwe's pads but he is struck down leg, and then goes to third man
nice reverse sweep over point for two, Nasir cuts it off just in front of the boundary. Got down early and got underneath it nicely too.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Chakabva b Panyangara 19 (25b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 76

dismissalComment.html: just a thin feather and Tamim has to go. Excellent lines and lengths these. Fuller than a good length just outside off and Tamim naughtily flirts at that with a defensive prod. He gets a thin outside edge which is easily accepted by the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c †Chakabva b Panyangara 7 (16b 0x4 1x6 16m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: Liton has to go, he tries to pull a delivery from well outside off to the leg side and was in no control of his shot. The ball keeps rising and gets a thin edge which is taken by the keeper over his head. Not a good shot that.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Chakabva b Cremer 4 (20b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah has to go now. The third batsman to edge to the keeper. He tries to run one off the face to third man but another edge, and the keeper takes another. Bangladesh are in a bit of trouble now

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Jongwe b Cremer 21 (28b 3x4 0x6 32m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: he is gone, huge wicket for Zim. Tossed up outside off, Rahim comes down and looks to go over cover but doesn't get to the pitch, the ball spins a tad and takes the outside edge towards short third man. The lob is well taken by the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Cremer b Williams 76 (89b 6x4 4x6 127m) SR: 85.39

dismissalComment.html: he smokes a full toss straight down the fielder's throat. Comes down the track and smashes a full toss right to Cremer at long-off. He is distraught as he walks off

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c †Chakabva b Jongwe 33 (40b 4x4 0x6 62m) SR: 82.5

dismissalComment.html: and Sabbir goes! Opportune wicket for Zim, too full outside off, Rahman goes for a full-blooded drive but the ball kisses the outside edge and the keeper takes another catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Chibhabha b Muzarabani 13 (14b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: Mash chooses the last delivery to go for the expansive shot. Not bad cricket but execution was lacking. Back of  a length outside off, Mashrafe flat-bats the pull but doesn't get all of it. The ball lobs to long-off for a simple catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Ervine b Panyangara 41 (53b 3x4 0x6 78m) SR: 77.35

dismissalComment.html: cracked to the fielder at deep midwicket. What a sound that made but he has picked out the fielder to inch-perfection. Ervine did not have to move to take that. Takes it just inside the boundary too. Short on off, Nasir stays in his crease and creams this pull but he has to go

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny c Ervine b Muzarabani 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: splendid fielding. What a catch that is. Full and wide, Sunny mis-times a drive towards cover but fails to keep it down, Ervine runs to his right, dives full-length and holds on to leave Bangladesh in further trouble

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha b Mashrafe Mortaza 14 (9b 1x4 1x6 25m) SR: 155.55

dismissalComment.html: bowled im now. Nips back in just a tad, Chibhabha brings the bat down at an angle and that results in a slightly skewed bat-face, a thick inside edge clatters into the stumps and Zim are now two down.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva lbw b Arafat Sunny 1 (19b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 5.26

dismissalComment.html: that is plumb. Straighter and skids on with the arm and strikes Chakabva right in front. No spin but Chakabva is playing for some. And a horror innings for Chakabva ends

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine run out (Litton Das) 26 (44b 3x4 0x6 68m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: that is close, poor run from Ervine. Excellent fielding from Liton at mid-off. And Ervine has to go. Pushed wider outside off and Ervine is already down the track but doesn't get close to the pitch, since he is already a few feet down, he judges the run to be there and goes through with it. Liton is quick on it and fires in an accurate throw at the non-strikers end. Ervine has to go

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Nasir Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman 14 (17b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 82.35

dismissalComment.html: and he goes! What a soft dismissal that is. Full on off, it may have been an offcutter and Williams goes after that and inside-halves it to the man at short midwicket. Poor shot and the loose cricket continues.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain 47 (77b 2x4 2x6 112m) SR: 61.03

dismissalComment.html: out, massive wicket for Bangladesh. Poor delivery, slower legcutter outside off, Chigumbura goes for the ramp over third man but doesn't get all of it, he uppishly cuts it and third man runs in and holds onto a sharp chance.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Imrul Kayes b Al-Amin Hossain 33 (42b 2x4 1x6 59m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: and the drinks break does the trick. Loss in concentration does it for Raza. Short outside off, Raza looks to flat-bat a pull over midwicket but the ball gets too big on him and he ends up slicing it to mid-on. Simple catch and a timely wicket for Bangladesh.

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 8 (22b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 36.36

dismissalComment.html: outside edge and taken by Rahim. Too short outside off and Waller rocks back and tries to power the ball through the covers but gets a thin outside edge which is well taken by Rahim standing up. Just chippin' away at these wickets are Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Mustafizur Rahman 11 (20b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: bowled im. Finally, Mustafizur hits the stumps.  A quick offcutter and the off stump is uprooted. A bit too full but Jongwe misses and the stumps are rattled. Is that the final nail in the coffin? The crowd goes wild

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasir Hossain 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: and that will be it. Easy win for Bangladesh and they complete the series win and a 2-0 lead in the series. Cremer runs past one as he tries to find some runs and Rahim does the rest.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara c Mashrafe Mortaza b Mustafizur Rahman 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: and another, Zimbabwe are capitulating now. Short outside off, TP looks to pull into the leg side but the ball hurries onto him and deviates a touch too. Spoons up for Mash at point and Zim are nine down

dismissalText.commentary: Taurai Muzarabani not out 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 46 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 142 runs, 4 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 11.1 overs (67 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: Bangladesh - 78/2 in 17.0 overs (Imrul Kayes 38, Mahmudullah 4)
Imrul Kayes: 50 off 53 balls (4 x 4, 3 x 6)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 21.3 overs (129 balls), Extras 13
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 31.2 overs (188 balls), Extras 14
Drinks: Bangladesh - 164/5 in 35.0 overs (Sabbir Rahman 19, Nasir Hossain 4)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 53 runs, 4 wickets)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 42.2 overs (254 balls), Extras 17
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 241/9 in 50.0 overs (Al-Amin Hossain 1, Mustafizur Rahman 5)
Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 49 runs, 3 wickets)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 10.1 overs (61 balls), Extras 9
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 122 runs, 3 wickets)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 61/3 in 15.0 overs (CR Ervine 16, E Chigumbura 7)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 24.3 overs (147 balls), Extras 12
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 67 balls (E Chigumbura 19, Sikandar Raza 25, Ex 10)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 149/4 in 33.0 overs (E Chigumbura 43, Sikandar Raza 32)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 33.2 overs (200 balls), Extras 19

stories.title: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Pakistan, 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2015-16

stories.title: Determined Al-Amin re-emerges stronger
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe in Bangladesh 2015-16
stories.summary: After a promising start, the Bangladesh fast bowler ran into problems with his action and off-field discipline. But he kept fighting, and that's now paying off for him and his team

image.caption: Al-Amin Hossain and his team struggled to find wickets
image.longCaption: Al-Amin Hossain and his team struggled to find wickets, West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st Test, St Vincent, 2nd day, September 6, 2014

stories.title: Nervous Kayes benefits from Mashrafe's advice
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Nervous Imrul Kayes benefits from Mashrafe Mortaza's advice
stories.summary: Imrul Kayes was playing his first ODI after a forgettable World Cup, and he put in a match-defining performance after getting some handy pre-match advice from his captain

image.caption: Imrul Kayes acknowledges his fifty
image.longCaption: Imrul Kayes acknowledges his fifty, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, November 9, 2015

stories.title: 'Batsmen gave it away' - Chigumbura
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Zimbabwe captain Elton Chigumbura said he felt that a target of 242 was possible to chase but pointed towards key dismissals that ended up costing his side heavily

stories.title: Bangladesh seal fifth ODI series in a row
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh seal fifth ODI series in a row
stories.summary: Bangladesh's 58-run win against Zimbabwe in the second ODI defending a total of 241 for 9 gave them an unassailable 2-0 lead and sealed their fifth consecutive bilateral ODI series win.

image.caption: Imrul Kayes walks back after being dismissed for 76
image.longCaption: Imrul Kayes walks back after being dismissed for 76, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, November 9, 2015

stories.title: 'Whoever gets set should try to score big' - Tamim
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Whoever gets set should try to score big' - Tamim
stories.summary: Bangladesh opener Tamim Iqbal has urged the set batsmen to carry on and make a big score rather than leave it for the others in the batting group

image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal swivels and pulls, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur, November 7, 2015

stories.title: Buoyant Bangladesh aim to wrap up series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Buoyant Bangladesh aim to wrap up series
stories.summary: Having comfortably won the first ODI, Bangladesh will look to seal their ninth bilateral series victory over Zimbabwe

recentReportStory.title: Bangladesh seal fifth ODI series in a row
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh seal fifth ODI series in a row
recentReportStory.summary: Bangladesh's 58-run win against Zimbabwe in the second ODI defending a total of 241 for 9 gave them an unassailable 2-0 lead and sealed their fifth consecutive bilateral ODI series win.

image.caption: Imrul Kayes walks back after being dismissed for 76
image.longCaption: Imrul Kayes walks back after being dismissed for 76, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, November 9, 2015

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84

recentPreviewStory.title: Buoyant Bangladesh aim to wrap up series
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Buoyant Bangladesh aim to wrap up series
recentPreviewStory.summary: Having comfortably won the first ODI, Bangladesh will look to seal their ninth bilateral series victory over Zimbabwe
recentPreviewStory.byline: The Preview by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan pulls through the leg side
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan pulls through the leg side, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st T20 international, Mirpur, July 5, 2015

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
